name: Haggunenons
source: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
summary: According to the Guide, the Haggunenons "have the most impatient chromosomes in the Galaxy. Whereas most species are content to evolve slowly and carefully over thousands of generations, discarding a prehensile toe here, [...] hazarding another nostril there, the Haggunenons would have done for Charles Darwin what a squadron of Arcturan Stunt Apples would have done for Sir Isaac Newton. Their genetic structure is based on the quadruple sterated octohelix...." Their tendency to evolve almost instantaneously has the downside of discarding one deficiency for another.

name: Halfworlders
summary: A species of anthropomorphic animals created from being given experiments on Halfworld.

name: Hallessi
summary: A subject species of the Race. Singular "Halless".

name: Harammins
source: The History of the Galaxy series)

name: Hardcore Hill Midgets
summary: They are found on the planet Zgraxxis.

name: Helmacrons
source: K. A. Applegate's Animorphs series (specifically books 24 and 42)
summary: Microscopic aliens with two arms and four legs, they are fungible, transferring their mind to another individual when killed. They are egotistical and have technology that can shrink other species down to their size.

name: Heptapods
summary: Giant octopus-like aliens with seven limbs

name: Hi-Five Aliens
summary: Characterized by long, single arm above their heads.

name: Hidetoshi Dekisugi (Parallel Planet on the contrary)
summary: Humanoid who is the gender-swapped version of Hidetoshi Dekisugi

name: Hierarchy
summary: A collective race of alien species including tall grey-like humanoid aliens, genetically altered beings, and enslaved alien races including the Skinwalkers.

name: Hive, The
summary: Gained starfaring capability after stealing a Terran ship.

name: Hoka
source: Poul Anderson and Gordon R. Dickson

name: Hooloovoo
source: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
summary: super-intelligent shade of the colour blue

name: Hork-Bajir
summary: Large, reptilian aliens with large blades at each of their joints and on their heads. Often referred to as 'salad mixers'. Usually peaceful, despite their appearance, as their blades were meant to be used for stripping bark off the very tall trees of their home world. Over 99% of the species has the mental capacity of a six-year-old human child, however, rarely one is of an intelligence on par with people like Albert Einstein, Isaac Newton and Stephen Hawking; such specimen are known as 'seers'

name: Howlers
summary: Artificial creatures with skin that looks like lava, a devastating scream attack, and a hive mind that allows them to share information and battle experience. Proficient in many forms of weaponry, the villain Crayak uses them to exterminate other species, designing them to view killing as a game... until they started kissing every sentient beings they saw.

name: Hunters (Lekgolo)
summary: Large creatures of immense strength and stature. They are made of hundreds if not thousands of worms formed together to make a single mind. Part of the Covenant Hierarchy.

name: Humma
summary: Marsupials, born female, change to male after giving birth.

name: Hynerians
summary: Slug-like. The Hynerian empire governs many worlds, some of which have humanoid inhabitants
